author: neels
msg: tree_conflicts_on_update_2_3 expected to get a "Skipped" message when
trying to update from *within* a directory deleted on the repository
(that also happens to be a tree-conflict victim). The tree-conflict-ness
does not change anything about a path missing in the repos, and
without stepping out to the parent dir, no tree-conflicts can be known
on the directory. See also this message:
Don't expect to "Skip" when updating *within* a "deleted" dir, twice.
Comment on that. Remove an obsolete warning comment.
(test_list): Don't XFail tree_conflicts_on_update_2_3, it passes now.

author: neels
msg: Fix tree-conflicts use case 2.2 (in update and switch).
Add parameter SCHEDULE. Mark MODIFIED as true when anything is
(test_list): Unmark XFail on tree_conflicts_on_update_2_2. It passes now.
(test_list): Unmark XFail on tree_conflicts_on_switch_2_2. It passes now.

author: neels
msg: Visit tree-conflicts cmdline tests for update, switch and merge.
Really expect all the desired behaviour, not accepting those known
errors that we passed to aid the ongoing development on tree-conflicts,
anymore. That adds a few XFails.
Streamline the composition of expected output, so that it is much
shorter and easier to read, as was still not done in some places.

author: neels
msg: Fix false positive in missing-node detection in dry_run merge.
Add MERGE_B argument. Use this to make assumptions about the working
kind in case of a MERGE_B->dry_run.

author: neels
msg: On branch merge-skips-obstructions: Check in first patch version by julianf.
Make "merge" check for obstructions and skip them, before looking for tree
Note: This patch makes a bunch of code redundant in each of the merge
callbacks, but does not remove or tidy up that code.
XPASS: merge_tests.py 19: merge should skip over unversioned obstructions
FAIL:  merge_tests.py 32: merge a replacement of a file
FAIL:  merge_tests.py 35: merge a replacement of a file to mixed rev wc
FAIL:  revert_tests.py 6: revert a merge replacement of file with history
FAIL:  revert_tests.py 15: revert a committed replace-with-history == no-op
(dry_run_deleted_p): Tweak the signature: accept a 'const' baton.
obstructed_or_missing() to check for obstructions early on.
(test_list): Remove the 'XFail' expectation from that test.
